defaultRestaurants.name: Panda Express
defaultRestaurants.description:
Panda Express serves gourmet Chinese food made with only the freshest ingredients. Famous for its Orange Chicken, they also offer a number of Wok Smart entrées that contain less than 250 calories per serving, such as Shanghai Angus Steak, Kung Pao Chicken, and Broccoli Beef. Other favorites include Beijing Beef, Sweetfire Chicken Breast, and Honey Walnut Shrimp.

Panda Express’ offerings can be enjoyed in Panda Bowls, or two and three item plates. Perfect for lunch, dinner or as a pick-me-up snack between classes.

defaultRestaurants.name: Le Crepe Cafe
defaultRestaurants.description:
Le Crêpe Café makes traditional French crêpes, cooked to order in front of customers. They specialize in a flavorsome menu of sweet and savory crêpes and use fresh ingredients, organic when possible. Their utensils are even bio-compostable. Enjoy a crêpe any time of day, as a breakfast, snack, main course, or dessert - close your eyes and you're in Paris!

Whether you’re needing a break from the law books or a pick-me-up as you’re headed to or off campus, you’ll also appreciate Le Crêpe Café’s French Roast and espresso drinks.

defaultRestaurants.name: L&L Hawaiian Barbecue
defaultRestaurants.description: Delicious local and Asian-American fusion cuisine served in big portions at reasonable prices! Try delicious L&L favorites like the Hawaiian Barbecue beef, chicken, or short ribs! Enjoy L&L's famous fried chicken katsu, the best in town! Grab-and-go, breakfast items and party packs for groups also available.

defaultRestaurants.name: Honolulu Gourmet Foods Cafe
defaultRestaurants.description: Honolulu Gourmet Foods Cafe features healthy, locally grown salads, sandwiches, poke bowls, and grab-and-go items at affordable prices.

defaultRestaurants.name: Da Spot
defaultRestaurants.description:
Da Spot Health Foods & Juices offers diverse, healthy and affordable cuisine with a unique take on tasty dishes from around the world. Da Spot specializes in Mediterranean and North African food with vegan and specialty meat options that can be certified halal or kosher. Offering imaginative cuisine in exotic styles of Egyptian, Greek, French, Italian, Indian, Thai, Malaysian, Ethiopian, American, Hawaiian, Japanese, Chinese, Korean, Pacific Rim and fusion cooking.

Da Spot's menu also features over 15 combinations of different fruit smoothies.

defaultRestaurants.name: Kamitoku Ramen
defaultRestaurants.description: Kamitoku Ramen specializes in a Tottori-style beef bone ramen.

defaultRestaurants.name: Lasoon
defaultRestaurants.description: Lasoon offers something for everyone with their signature exotic South Indian and Malaysian cuisine. Daily specials include chicken curry, lamb masala, garlic shrimp, seafood curry, spinach tofu, spicy eggplant, curried potatoes, coconut cabbage & over 10 different vegetarian entrees to choose from. Spiciness ranges from mild to very hot.

defaultRestaurants.name: Holoholo Grill
defaultRestaurants.description: Holoholo Grill features healthy, locally grown salads, sandwiches, and grab-and-go items at affordable prices. They are committed to using the freshest island-grown ingredients sourced directly from farmers and fishermen. Grab-and-go, breakfast items, or catering for any sized group are also available!

defaultRestaurants.name: Govinda's
defaultRestaurants.description:
Want a sustainable selection for lunch? Try Govinda's, which offers a 100% pure vegetarian menu, with items low in cholesterol and mostly organic. They strive to bring you a healthy and delicious meal at the best possible price.

Govinda's uses top quality produce and only the finest quality sea salt. All of the rice, grains, beans, tofu, sugar and flour are certified organic. Their menu never contains any meat or meat by-products, fish, eggs, MSG, iodized salt, preservatives, hydrogenated oils, or artificial colors or flavors.

defaultRestaurants.name: Ba-Le
defaultRestaurants.description:
Ba-Le is the perfect stop if you're craving something a little different. 

Pastries, sandwiches, and pre-made salads are some of their quick lunch options. Popular items at Ba-Le include pho, pad thai, and banh mi sandwiches. 

Also offered at Ba-Le are a selection of La Tour Cafe macarons and entrees.

Spend your meal time at Ba-Le for a variety of foods and flavors!

defaultRestaurants.name: Jamba Juice
defaultRestaurants.description:
Visit Jamba for refreshing fruit smoothie blends, delicious and nutritious energy bowls, fresh juices, healthy baked goods and savory grab-and-go food items.

Jamba blends real fruit and whole ingredients into each delicious fresh juice, smoothie, or energy bowl you order and contains no artificial colors, preservatives, or flavors.

defaultRestaurants.name: Dunkin' Donuts
defaultRestaurants.description: Dunkin’ Donuts in Paradise Palms Cafe will keep Hawaii running with high-quality beverage offerings–including freshly-brewed Hot and Iced Coffees–paired perfectly with delicious donuts, bakery good, sandwiches and more.

defaultSubmits.menu: theres food believe it or not

defaultReviews.title: love these crepes
defaultReviews.description: so good whether i get a BLT or a PBJ, it just melts in my mouth

defaultReviews.title: RIP Six Pack
defaultReviews.description: Ugh! Me and my demanding belly! No wonder my six pack its taking longer to come out even that i work out pretty much every day! Anyways, today was a sin day with sweets (well, trully every day is a sin day for my belly)

defaultReviews.title: hits da spot
defaultReviews.description: some really tasty food , and healthy too!

defaultReviews.title: great for vegan food
defaultReviews.description: good pasta entrees: orzo (irregular), lasagna (weds). hearty soups. chili powder avail to spice things up.

defaultReviews.title: great for a pick-me-up
defaultReviews.description: Fast, relatively healthy food! Tasty generous portions and flavors/ingredients. Great place to come after a good hike or activity.

defaultReviews.title: finger licking good
defaultReviews.description: I can't get enough of their chicken, whether its the katsu, curry, or BBQ!

defaultReviews.title: Good food, good size servings
defaultReviews.description: The food here is very good. The servings are relatively large. The food is always fresh. And convenient. You walk in, look at the menu board, order, wait a few minutes, and then you have yourself a good meal. Nice folks working there also.

defaultReviews.title: and I already thought Chinese food was bad...
defaultReviews.description: if you want boring, bland, expensive 'chinese' food, go here

defaultReviews.title: pretty good food, but not much of it
defaultReviews.description: very tasty, but small portions.  Also I think beef is an ingredient in everything but the soda

defaultReviews.title: good selection, mildly expensive
defaultReviews.description: lots to choose from, but taste and prices aren't great

defaultReviews.title: Vegan Friendly :D
defaultReviews.description: The food here is very good, from the curries to the veggies (vegan!) down to even the rice and the hot sauce!! All of it is sooo goood

defaultReviews.title: Simple but good
defaultReviews.description: The broth was great, very tasty, however I was disappointed that the noodles seemed to be out of a packet of cheap microwave noodles. Other than that, this was decent ramen and nice and cheap

defaultReviews.title: Quick, easy, and great!
defaultReviews.description: My go to meal replacement for lunchtime. You can add soy to it and make it more filling. I just discover their energy bowls and they are yum!

defaultReviews.title: Found my favorite spot
defaultReviews.description: The greatest food! Everything they serve is exceptional and unique. Gourmet local grinds.

defaultReviews.title: Not to miss!
defaultReviews.description: Honestly the best Vietnamese food I've ever had and Im no stranger to this cuisine.  All of the food was booming with flavor !!!  The lemongrass chicken sandwich was on point and the bread had the perfect amount of crunch and softness. The papaya salad crunchiness and sweetness perfectly complemented the chicken. I had this last week and am drooling as I write this lol. Super craveable !!

defaultReviews.title: Good coffee, but the food...
defaultReviews.description: I love Dunkin' Donuts coffee. I brew it at home. If I were rating just the coffee I'd give it 5 stars. The rest of their products are pretty average or below. They do have good muffins but their donuts are rather average. I stopped buying their breakfast sandwiches because they are lousy. They have these round doughy things they try to pass off as bagels. Their English muffins are even English muffins anymore. A couple of years ago they substituted these dinner roll type things for English muffins. (Note to DD: English muffins are suppose to be crisp.) Even their eggs are not eggs.

defaultReviews.title: I highly recommend it!
defaultReviews.description: Ever since they opened towards the end of summer this has quickly become one of my favorite places to grab a bite on campus.  They've got a nice spread of salads, sandwiches, and other tasty treats, and they've got froyo!

defaultReviews.title: idk why but i can't get enough
defaultReviews.description: for some reason i could eat here all day.  I tell you, it's worth the high blood pressure!
